name: Trouble in Paradise
description: Vacationing on Risa, you meet Captain Lynne Lucero, who is on administrative leave after the destruction of her ship. Together, you stumble onto an assassination plot against Admiral Forrest! Uncover the plot and deal with the culprit.
rules:
— Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
— Using any version of Forrest, Lucero, Dolim, or crew with the Survivalist trait will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
— Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
— Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
— In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Forrest, Lucero, Dolim, or Survivalists
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

adventures.name: Employee of the Month
adventures.description: Examine the odd employee's personnel file.

adventures.name: Photographic Evidence
adventures.description: Take a clear photograph of the odd employee, to be analyzed.

adventures.name: Lights, Camera, Action
adventures.description: Collect the resort's surveillance tapes of the odd employee.

adventures.name: Identity Theft
adventures.description: Build a file on the odd employee. Find out who he really is.

adventures.description: Grab the poison in Dolim's jacket for the Federation.

action.name: At the Tip of My Blade
He's an Idiot

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Give the Dominion a chance to withdraw peacefully.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "Hey there! Nice to see another Starfleet Captain who chose to vacation on Risa. Would you like to join me? Just...try to lean forward so that the Admiral over there can't see me. I don't want him to...Oh GREAT, he's coming over...."

"Captain Lucero. Administrative leave is meant to be a time of reflection. I hope you aren't on Risa celebrating the gross incompetence that led to the loss of your ship. I read that report, and you're lucky you weren't demoted back down to Cadet! I'll be watching you...."

"That's all I need, an Admiral spying on me during my vacation. And...that waiter just followed him out of here pretty quickly. If the Admiral is engaging the resort staff to spy on me, I won't get a moment's peace."
"Would you mind following that server, and the Admiral, to see if there's anything strange going on? My instincts are usually pretty good. Something isn't right."

responses.text: "The server is not who he seems."

screens.text: "Captain! Did you find out anything about that server? It felt off."
"This information is highly credible, Captain. We need to protect Admiral Forrest! And if we end up saving him, maybe he won't think I'm a total failure."

"There's no denying this evidence, Captain. You've been thorough. Uncanny how the Xindi can disguise themselves as humans. It makes them extra dangerous. We need to help the Admiral, whether he realizes it or not."
"A Xindi assassin? Wow. While I'm not happy there's a threat to Admiral Forrest, I am glad I can still rely on my intuitions."
"You've been in Starfleet longer. How do you think we should proceed, Captain?"

"Removing this threat altogether seems to be in the Federation's best interest. A prisoner like Commander Dolim could offer Starfleet crucial information about the Xindi. And again, saving an Admiral would sure help my personnel file right about now. Let's work on that!"

"So, release Dolim now, to avoid a worse conflict later? I like the way you think, Captain. Let's do what we can to convince Dolim to leave, or to get the Dominion to recall him. Not the way I expected to spend a vacation on Risa, but if it offers me some redemption, so be it."
